meanings.sent1: The pond was the slimiest after the rain, with a thick layer of green slime covering its surface.
meanings.sent2: The snail left a slimy trail behind as it moved across the garden.
meanings.sent3: The slimiest part of the horror movie was when the monster emerged from the dark, slimy and dripping with goo.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as slimy as a snake, hiding her true intentions behind a facade of sweetness.
meanings.sent5: The slimiest feeling in the world is stepping on a slug barefoot in the middle of the night.

meanings.definition: Having a slippery or deceitful quality
meanings.sent1: The politician's slimiest trick was promising one thing before the election and doing the opposite after.
meanings.sent2: The used car salesman had the slimiest smile, making you doubt every word he said.
meanings.sent3: The fox was the slimiest creature in the forest, always finding a way to outsmart the other animals.
meanings.sent4: Her words were as slimy as butter, slipping smoothly into the ears of those who listened.
meanings.sent5: The slimiest part of the mystery was when the detective realized his partner had been lying to him all along.

meanings.sent1: Of all the creatures in the swamp, the frog was the slimiest, its skin glistening with moisture.
meanings.sent2: The alley behind the restaurant was the slimiest place in town, with discarded food and grease covering the ground.
meanings.sent3: The slimiest character in the play turned out to be the charming prince, who was secretly plotting against the kingdom.
meanings.sent4: The slimiest part of the story was when the hero had to trust the villain to save the day.
meanings.sent5: The slimiest feeling in the room was the tension between the two rivals, each trying to outdo the other.
